revision.text:
{{Expand German|Julius Klinger|date=December 2009}} {{Refimprove|date=May 2009}}<!--all info can be found with Anita Kühnel: "Julius Klinger - Bilderheft der Staatlichen Museen zu Berlin", but I can't find the time to check out page numbers, user:tickle me--> <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Julius Klinger Portrait.jpg|thumb|right|140px|Julius Klinger, date unknown]] --> '''Julius Klinger''' (22 May 1876 – 1942) was an [[Austria]]n painter, draftsman, illustrator, commercial graphic artist, typographer and writer. Klinger studied at the Technologisches Gewerbemuseum in [[Vienna]].<ref name="AEIOU ">[http://www.aeiou.at/aeiou.encyclop.k/k464961.htm;internal&action=_setlanguage.action?LANGUAGE=en Austrian AEIOU Encyclopedia]</ref>
== Early works in Vienna and Munich == <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Die Jugend 1896.jpg|thumb|right|100px|Die Jugend, 1896]] --> [[Image:Meggendorfer Blätter 27.03.1930.jpg|thumb|left|220px|Meggendorfer Blätter, 1930]] Klinger was born in Dornbach near [[Vienna]]. In 1895, he found his first employment with the [[Vienna]] fashion magazine ''Wiener Mode''. Here he made acquaintance with [[Koloman Moser]], who later would be his teacher; Moser recommended him to the ''[[Meggendorfer-Blätter]]''.<ref name="onbJK">[http://www2.onb.ac.at/siteseeing/flu/schaetze_neu/schaetze-kuenstler.htm Julius Klinger (Wien 22. 5. 1976-1942?)] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080918024028/http://www2.onb.ac.at/siteseeing/flu/schaetze_neu/schaetze-kuenstler.htm |date=2008-09-18 }}, biographical entry with the [[Austrian National Library]]</ref>
1896 saw him moving to [[Munich]] where he worked as an illustrator for the ''Meggendorfer-Blätter''<ref>{{cite book|author=David Ciarlo|title=Advertising Empire|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=4ceZNb2h4BQC&pg=PA292|accessdate=4 September 2016|date=January 2011|publisher=Harvard University Press|isbn=978-0-674-05006-8|page=292}}</ref> and others. From 1897 to 1902 he was a collaborator to the eponymous [[Jugendstil]] magazine ''[[Die Jugend]]''.
== Berlin == [[Image:Julius Klinger Möhring Kronleuchter 1908.jpg|thumb|150px|right|Julius Klinger: 1908, Möhring candelabra factory]] In 1897 he relocated to Berlin, where he worked extensively as a commercial graphic artist until 1915. Together with the printing house Hollerbaum und Schmidt, he developed a new fashion of functional poster design that soon gained him international reputation.<ref name="onbJK" /> In 1912 he designed the poster for the ''Rund um Berlin'' air show in [[Johannisthal Air Field|Johannisthal]]. In Berlin he also contributed to ''Das kleine Witzblatt'', ''Lustige Blätter'' and ''Das Narrenschiff'' humorous magazines.
== Advertising campaign for the "Tabu" company == [[Image:Julius Klinger Tabu Hauswand ca.1920.jpg|thumb|150px|right|Julius Klinger: firewall, ca.1920]] <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Julius Klinger Tabu Poster 1919.jpg|thumb|100px|left|J. Klinger: Poster ca. 1919]] --> Beginning in 1918, Klinger designed a comprehensive and noted campaign promoting the "Tabu" company's cigarette rolling paper, that was advertised all over Vienna in 1918/19. Klinger devised a promotional strategy, spanning from small-sized newspaper advertisements to billboards and painted [[Firewall (construction)|firewalls]] – construction site fences and winterized fountain paneling were used as advertising space, too.<ref name="onb2003">[http://www.onb.ac.at/sammlungen/plakate/archiv/erwerb/objekt_juni_2003.htm Plakat: Julius Klinger: Tabu, 1919] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040823140137/http://www.onb.ac.at/sammlungen/plakate/archiv/erwerb/objekt_juni_2003.htm |date=2004-08-23 }}, [[Austrian National Library]], 2003</ref>
== Nazi persecution == [[Image:Julius Klinger Ankerbrot 1938.jpg|thumb|150px|left|Julius Klinger, late 1937, Vienna]] Being of Jewish descent, he suffered from [[Nazism|national socialist]] harassment. According to Viennese police records, he was registered as ''moved to [[Minsk]]'' on 2 June 1942, i.e. deported. Presumably, he was killed the same year.<ref name="onbJK" />
Probably towards the end of 1937 he designed his last poster for the Ankerbrot-Werke factory. The Jewish-owned company was transferred to "''Aryan''" proprietors in 1938; after 1945 legitimate ownership was restored.
== Literature == * Anita Kühnel: ''Julius Klinger – Bilderheft der Staatlichen Museen zu Berlin'' (Catalogue of the [[Berlin State Museums]]), Gebr. Mann, Berlin, 1999
== Some of his work == <gallery mode="nolines" widths="200px" heights="400px"> Image:Julius Klinger-Poster Tabu, 1919.JPG|<center>Werbung (1919).</center> Image:Julius Klinger WWI poster.jpg|<center>Poster for 8<sup>e</sup> war loan, [[Austria-Hungary]] (1918).</center> Image:Klinger-Johannisthal-1908.jpg|<center>Aéroport Johannisthal de Berlin (1908).</center> Image:Julius Klinger - Hermanns & Froitzheim - Google Art Project.jpg|<center>Cravates Hermanns & Froitzheim (1911).</center> Image:Klinger-Tabu-1919.JPG|Poster for "Tabu"-cigarette paper (1919). Image:Julius Klinger-Elida-1921.jpg|Poster for "Elida" toilet soap, (1921). Image:Julius Klinger - Wiener Messe, 1922.JPG|<center>Foire de Vienne (1922).</center> Image:Klinger-M. E. Mayer Rasierklingen.JPG|<center>Lame de rasoir du viennois M. E. Mayer (1922).</center> Image:Klinger-Parfümeriefabrik Pessl, 1923.JPG|Poster of the Viennese perfume company Pessl (1923). </gallery>
== External links == * {{Commons category inline|Julius Klinger}} * [http://www.ifs.tuwien.ac.at/~andi/somlib/data/standard_1999/output/files/19991112.87.HTM Dr.Wiles-Worris – Weil's woah is], [[Der Standard]], 12. November 1999 * Anita Kühnel: [https://web.archive.org/web/20150115164844/http://www.austrianposters.at/pages/grafiker/kuehnel_julius_klinger_en.html Julius Klinger – Poster Artist and Draftsman]
== Notes == {{Reflist}}
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Klinger, Julius}} [[Category:19th-century Austrian painters]] [[Category:Austrian male painters]] [[Category:20th-century Austrian painters]] [[Category:Austrian male writers]] [[Category:Austrian typographers]] [[Category:Austrian Jews]] [[Category:People from Hernals]] [[Category:Murdered artists]] [[Category:Poster artists]] [[Category:Austrian people murdered abroad]] [[Category:1876 births]] [[Category:1942 deaths]] [[Category:Jewish artists]]

revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=October 2013}} {{Infobox Hollywood cartoon| |cartoon_name = Jungle Jitters |series = [[Merrie Melodies]] |image = Introducción de la caricatura 'Jungle Jitters'.png |caption = Title card |director = [[Friz Freleng|I. Freleng]] |story artist = [[George Manuell]] |animator = [[Phil Monroe]] |musician = [[Carl Stalling]] |voice_actor = [[Mel Blanc]]
[[Tedd Pierce]] |producer = [[Leon Schlesinger]] |distributor = [[Warner Bros.|Warner Bros. Pictures]]
[[The Vitaphone Corporation]] |release_date = February 19, 1938 (USA) |color_process = [[Technicolor]] |runtime = 8 min (one reel) |movie_language = English }} '''''Jungle Jitters''''' is a [[1938]] ''[[Merrie Melodies]]'' cartoon directed by [[Friz Freleng]]. ==Plot== [[File:Jungle Jitters.ogv|thumb|left|Jungle Jitters]] [[File:Una escena de la caricatura 'Jungle Jitters'.png|thumb|left|A scene from the film.]] In an African jungle, the natives are going about their day, with the jungle elements being intertwined with modern-day elements; for example, the people dancing around a tent when it turns into a makeshift merry-go-round, to the tune of ''[[The Merry-Go-Round Broke Down]]'' which has since become the longtime ''[[Looney Tunes]]'' theme song. A traveling dog-like salesman named Manny (a parody of [[Al Pearce]]'s character Elmer Blurt) comes by to offer them the latest in "assorted useful, useless, utensils". The natives capture him, throw him into a pot of boiling water, and ransack his goods. They proceed to familiarize themselves with vacuum cleaners, batteries, light bulbs, etc. When the salesman is introduced to the village queen (depicted as a chicken-like white woman, possibly to avoid any problems with the [[Motion Picture Production Code|Hays code]] over the issue of [[miscegenation]]), she takes a liking to him, imagining Manny the salesman as [[Clark Gable]] and [[Robert Taylor (actor)|Robert Taylor]]. The salesman finds himself with the choice between a forced marriage with the homely queen, or the boiling pot of water. He chooses the pot, and in a closing shot as he sinks into the broth, hopes "they all get indigestion." ==Availability== *''Jungle Jitters'' fell into the [[public domain]] in 1966, and is available on many public domain home video collections. ==See also== *[[List of animated films in the public domain in the United States]] ==Notes== *Because of the [[ethnic stereotyping|racial stereotypes]] used against [[African-American|black people]] throughout the short, it prompted [[United Artists]] to withhold it from [[Broadcast syndication|syndication]] within the United States in 1968. As such, the short was placed it into the so-called [[Censored Eleven]], a group of eleven ''Merrie Melodies'' and ''Looney Tunes'' shorts withheld from television distribution in the United States since 1968 due to heavy stereotyping of black people.The Straight Dope. *The short was also referenced in the ''[[Looney Tunes]]'' short, ''[[The Ducksters]]'' (1950), but is not related to what [[Daffy Duck]] was talking about because he mentioned a gorilla and the original short did not feature a gorilla. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commonscat}} *{{YouTube|ssoFdlyd5uo|''Jungle Jitters''}} *{{IMDb title|30300}} *{{bcdb title|467}} {{Friz Freleng}} {{Censored Eleven}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jungle Jitters}} [[Category:1930s American animated films]] [[Category:1938 animated films]] [[Category:1938 films]] [[Category:American short films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:Articles containing video clips]] [[Category:Cannibal films]] [[Category:Censored Eleven]] [[Category:Films about race and ethnicity]] [[Category:Films scored by Carl Stalling]] [[Category:Short films directed by Friz Freleng]] [[Category:Films set in Africa]] [[Category:Merrie Melodies shorts]] [[Category:Queens, New York in fiction]] [[Category:Warner Bros. Cartoons animated short films]] [[Category:Vitaphone short films]] [[Category:American animated short films]] {{MerrieMelodies-stub}}

{{featured article}} {{Use British English|date=April 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2015}} {{Infobox film | name = Kahaani | image = KahaaniPoster.jpg | caption = Theatrical release poster | alt = Theatrical release poster depicts a pregnant woman, with a sightly surprised expression, standing. The city of Kolkata, during Durga Puja, is in the background. Text at the bottom of the poster reveals the title, tagline, production credits and release date. | director = [[Sujoy Ghosh]] | producer = Sujoy Ghosh
Kushal Kantilal Gada | starring = [[Vidya Balan]]
[[Parambrata Chatterjee]]
[[Nawazuddin Siddiqui]]
[[Indraneil Sengupta]]
[[Saswata Chatterjee]] | music = '''Songs:'''
[[Vishal-Shekhar]]
'''Background score:'''
[[Clinton Cerejo]] | cinematography = Setu | editing = [[Namrata Rao]] | story = Sujoy Ghosh
[[Advaita Kala]] | screenplay = Sujoy Ghosh | studio = [[Sujoy Ghosh|Boundscript Motion Pictures]] | distributor = [[Viacom 18 Motion Pictures]]
[[Pen India Limited]] | released = {{Film date|2012|3|9|df=y}} | runtime = 122 minutes{{cite web|url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/kahaani-2012-0|title=''Kahaani'' (15)|work=[[British Board of Film Classification]]|date=2 March 2012|accessdate=1 October 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150223162855/http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/kahaani-2012-0|archivedate=23 February 2015|df=}} | country = [[India]] | language = Hindi | budget = {{INRConvert|80|m}}{{cite news|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/vidya-balans-kahaani-declared-a-hit/238407-8-66.html|title=Vidya Balan's ''Kahaani'' declared a hit|publisher=[[CNN-IBN]]|date=12 March 2012|accessdate=21 March 2013|agency=[[Indo-Asian News Service]]|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131205151114/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/vidya-balans-kahaani-declared-a-hit/238407-8-66.html|archivedate=5 December 2013|df=}} | gross = {{INRConvert|1.04|b}}{{cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/vidya-balan-s-kahaani-completes-50-days-grosses-rs-104-cr-worldwide/article1-847121.aspx|title=Vidya Balan's ''Kahaani'' completes 50 days, grosses Rs. 104 cr worldwide|newspaper=[[Hindustan Times]]|accessdate=27 April 2012|date=27 April 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120428164829/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Vidya-Balan-s-Kahaani-completes-50-days-grosses-Rs-104-cr-worldwide/Article1-847121.aspx|archivedate=28 April 2012|df=}} }} '''''Kahaani''''' ({{IPA-hns|kəˈɦaːni|IPA}}; {{lit|Story}}) is a 2012 Indian [[Hindi]]-language [[mystery film|mystery]] [[thriller film]] co-written, co-produced and directed by [[Sujoy Ghosh]]. It stars [[Vidya Balan]] as Vidya Bagchi, a pregnant woman searching for her missing husband in [[Kolkata]] during the festival of [[Durga Puja]], assisted by Satyoki "Rana" Sinha ([[Parambrata Chatterjee]]) and Khan ([[Nawazuddin Siddiqui]]). Made on a shoestring budget of {{INRConvert|80|m}}, ''Kahaani'' was conceived and developed by Ghosh, who co-wrote the film with [[Advaita Kala]]. The crew often employed [[guerrilla filmmaking|guerrilla-filmmaking]] techniques on [[Kolkata]]'s city streets to avoid attracting attention. The film was noted for its deft portrayal of the city and for making use of many local crew and cast members. ''Kahaani'' explores themes of feminism and motherhood in male-dominated Indian society. The film also makes several allusions to [[Satyajit Ray]]'s films such as ''[[Charulata]]'' (1964), ''[[Aranyer Dinratri]]'' (1970) and ''[[Joi Baba Felunath (film)|Joi Baba Felunath]]'' (1979). ''Kahaani'' was released worldwide on 9 March 2012. Critics praised the screenplay, the cinematography and the performances of the lead actors. Following critical acclaim and word-of-mouth publicity, the film earned {{INRConvert|1.04|b}} worldwide in 50 days. The film won [[List of accolades received by Kahaani|several awards]], including three [[National Film Awards]] and five [[Filmfare Awards]]. The latter included trophies for [[Filmfare Award for Best Director|Best Director]] (Ghosh) and [[Filmfare Award for Best Actress|Best Actress]] (Vidya). A sequel, titled ''[[Kahaani 2: Durga Rani Singh]]'', was released on 2 December 2016. == Plot == A poison-gas attack on a [[Kolkata Metro]] Rail compartment kills the passengers on board. Two years later Vidya Bagchi ([[Vidya Balan]]), a pregnant [[software engineer]], arrives in [[Kolkata]] from London during the [[Durga Puja]] festivities in search of her missing husband, Arnab Bagchi. A police officer, Satyoki "Rana" Sinha ([[Parambrata Chatterjee]]), offers to help. Although Vidya claims that Arnab went to Kolkata on an assignment for the National Data Center (NDC), initial investigations suggest that no such person was employed by the NDC. Agnes D'Mello, the NDC's head of human resources, suggests to Vidya that her husband resembled former employee Milan Damji ([[Indraneil Sengupta]]), whose file is probably kept in the old NDC office. Before Agnes can provide any further help she is killed by Bob Biswas ([[Saswata Chatterjee]]), an assassin working undercover as a life insurance agent. Vidya and Rana break into the NDC office and find Damji's file, barely escaping an encounter with Bob, who is searching for the same information. Meanwhile, the attempts to obtain Damji's records have attracted the attention of two [[Intelligence Bureau (India)|Intelligence Bureau]] (IB) officials in Delhi—the chief Bhaskaran K. ([[Dhritiman Chatterjee]]) and his deputy Khan ([[Nawazuddin Siddiqui]]). Khan arrives in Kolkata and reveals that Damji was a rogue IB agent responsible for the poison-gas attack. In spite of Khan's warnings, Vidya continues her search, fearing that Arnab's resemblance to Damji may have led him into trouble. The address on Damji's record leads Vidya and Rana to a dilapidated flat. An errand boy from the neighbourhood tea stall identifies R. Sridhar (Shantilal Mukherjee), an NDC officer, as a frequent visitor to Damji's flat. Bob attempts to kill Vidya, but fails, and is run over by a car during a chase. Examination of Bob's mobile phone leads Vidya and Rana to an [[IP address]] sending instructions to kill her. They break into Sridhar's office to verify his IP address, but he is alerted electronically and returns to his office. Vidya accidentally shoots Sridhar dead during a scuffle, which upsets Khan, who had wanted him alive. Sridhar's computer data reveals a code, which when deciphered reveals Bhaskaran's phone number. Vidya calls Bhaskaran to tell him that she has retrieved sensitive documents from Sridhar's office. She asks Bhaskaran to help find her husband in exchange for the documents, but Bhaskaran tells her to contact the local police. Vidya soon gets a call from an unknown number however, warning her that she should hand over the documents to the caller if she wishes to see her husband alive. Khan thinks the caller is Milan Damji. Vidya goes to meet Damji, followed by Rana and Khan. Damji cuts the meeting short when Vidya expresses her doubt that he will be able to return her husband in exchange for the sensitive file, and he attempts to leave. Vidya tries to stop him, and in the ensuing struggle Damji draws a gun on her. Vidya disarms him using the prosthetic belly she has been using to fake her pregnancy and promptly stabbing him in the neck with her [[hair stick]], after shooting him with his own gun. She flees into the crowd before the police arrive, leaving a thank you note for Rana and a [[USB flash drive|pen drive]] containing data from Sridhar's computer, which leads to Bhaskaran's arrest. Rana concludes that no Vidya or Arnab Bagchi ever existed, and that Vidya had been using the police and the IB to achieve her own ends. Vidya is revealed to be the widow of Arup Basu ([[Abir Chatterjee]]), an IB officer and Damji's colleague, who was killed in the poison-gas attack, which also caused Vidya to immediately fall unconscious upon seeing her husband's corpse and suffer a miscarriage. In her mission to avenge his and their unborn child's death, Vidya was helped by retired IB officer Pratap Bajpayee ([[Darshan Jariwala]]), who suspected the involvement of a top IB official. == Cast == * [[Vidya Balan]] as Vidya Venkatesan Bagchi * [[Parambrata Chatterjee]] as Satyoki "Rana" Sinha * [[Nawazuddin Siddiqui]] as A. Khan * [[Indraneil Sengupta]] as Milan Damji * [[Dhritiman Chatterjee]] as Bhaskaran K. * [[Saswata Chatterjee]] as Bob Biswas * [[Darshan Jariwala]] as Colonel Pratap Bajpayee * [[Abir Chatterjee]] as Arup Basu * [[Shantilal Mukherjee]] as R. Shridhar, chief technical officer at the NDC * [[Kharaj Mukherjee]] as Inspector Chatterjee, a friendly inspector at the Kalighat Police Station. * Colleen Blanche as Agnes D'Mello * Nitya Ganguli as Mr. Das, the guest house owner. * Ritabrata Mukherjee as Bishnu, a worker at the guest house. * Pamela Bhuttoria as Sapna, an employee at NDC. * Kalyan Chatterjee as Paresh Pal, a clay artist and a police informer. * [[Riddhi Sen]] as Poltu, a worker at a tea-stall. * Massod Akhtar as Rasik Tyagi, systems supervisor at the NDC == Production == === Development === [[Sujoy Ghosh]] approached novelist and script writer [[Advaita Kala]] with the idea for the film.{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/vidya-balan-is-the-hero-of-kahaani-says-scriptwriter-advaita-kala_75637.htm|title=Vidya Balan is the hero of ''Kahaani'', says scriptwriter Advaita Kala|publisher=[[Zee News]]|agency=[[Press Trust of India]] (PTI)|accessdate=30 March 2012|date=16 November 2010|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120706041728/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/vidya-balan-is-the-hero-of-kahaani-says-scriptwriter-advaita-kala_75637.htm|archivedate=6 July 2012|df=}} Kala took inspiration from her experience in Kolkata, where she had moved in 1999, akin to the protagonist in the film.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-16/books/31142700_1_kahaani-sujoy-ghosh-vidya-balan|title=Vidya's journey was my own: Advaita Kala|first=Ipshita|last=Mitra|newspaper=The Times of India|accessdate=8 May 2012|date=16 March 2012}} She reported that despite facing a language barrier and the chaos and poverty of the metropolis, she was charmed by the warmth of the people, which was reflected in the film.{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/kahaani-story-inspired-from-real-life-experiences_107223.htm|title=''Kahaani'' story inspired from real-life experiences|publisher=Zee News|agency=PTI|accessdate=21 March 2012|date=7 March 2012}} Kala started writing in 2009 and finished the 185-page script by February 2010.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-01-15/news-interviews/30627829_1_novel-sujoy-ghosh-release|title=Vidya's ''Kahaani'' to release as novel|first=Priyanka|last=Dasgupta|newspaper=The Times of India|agency=[[Times News Network]] (TNN)|accessdate=26 March 2012|date=15 January 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/advaita-kala-had-to-tell-vidyas-story-right/237060-40-103.html|title=''Kahaani'': Advaita Kala says she had to tell Vidya's story right|first=Malvika|last=Bhardwaj|publisher=[[CNN-IBN]]|accessdate=21 March 2012|date=7 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120309225621/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/advaita-kala-had-to-tell-vidyas-story-right/237060-40-103.html|archivedate=9 March 2012|df=}} Her research included reading the books ''Open Secrets: India's Intelligence Unveiled'' by Maloy Krishna Dhar and ''India's External Intelligence: Secrets of [[Research and Analysis Wing]] (RAW)'' by V. K. Singh. Ghosh, who co-wrote the story and the screenplay, began to plan the film while awaiting the release of his previous film ''[[Aladin (2009 film)|Aladin]]'' (2009), but the dismal response to ''Aladin'' was a setback. He had to approach several producers to finance him for ''Kahaani'', but was refused and discouraged from making the film owing to three factors: a pregnant woman as the lead star, a bunch of unknown Bengali actors as the supporting cast and Kolkata as a backdrop.{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/bollywood/kahaani-everything-that-a-film-should-not-be-sujoy-ghosh_109182.htm|title=''Kahaani'' everything that a film should not be: Sujoy Ghosh|publisher=Zee News|agency=PTI|accessdate=10 April 2012|date=9 April 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120411001732/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/bollywood/kahaani-everything-that-a-film-should-not-be-sujoy-ghosh_109182.htm|archivedate=11 April 2012|df=}} [[Yashraj Films]] were willing to produce the film, but wanted Ghosh to sign a three-film deal, which he declined because he did not want that much commitment. Bengali film actor [[Prosenjit Chatterjee]] encouraged Ghosh to shoot in Kolkata.{{cite news|url=http://newindianexpress.com/entertainment/hindi/article324563.ece|title=The story behind ''Kahaani''|first=Ayaz|last=Shaikh|newspaper=[[The Indian Express]]|accessdate=26 March 2012|date=26 February 2012}} Ghosh finally selected Kolkata for several reasons: the director's acquaintance with the city, its mix of modernity and old-world charm, and budget constraints. Kolkata is a cheaper location than Mumbai or Delhi, where most Bollywood films are shot.{{cite news|url=http://www.moneycontrol.com/news/entertainment/if-kahaani-failed-id-have-to-pack-my-baggo-sujoy-ghosh_689018.html|title=If ''Kahaani'' failed I'd have to pack my bag & go: Sujoy Ghosh|publisher=Moneycontrol|agency=CNBC-TV18|accessdate=5 April 2012|date=4 April 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407065305/http://www.moneycontrol.com/news/entertainment/if-kahaani-failed-id-have-to-pack-my-baggo-sujoy-ghosh_689018.html|archivedate=7 April 2012|df=}} Ghosh admitted in an interview that after his two preceding directorial ventures—''Aladin'' and ''[[Home Delivery (film)|Home Delivery]]'' (2005)—performed poorly at the box office, ''Kahaani'' was his last chance to create a niche as a director.{{cite video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eaNZSI4zX2o|title=Rajeev Masand interview with director Sujoy Ghosh on ''Kahaani''|publisher=CNN-IBN|people=Ghosh, Sujoy|type=Television production|date=March 2012|time=1:25|accessdate=30 March 2012|df=|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150712021551/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eaNZSI4zX2o|archivedate=12 July 2015}} He added that the film's plot twist came somewhat accidentally. Having described the skeleton of the story to a friend during its development, the friend called him back a few days later to enquire about his film. The friend had mistakenly imagined sequences which he assumed to be parts of the plot, from which the twist ending was derived.{{cite video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eaNZSI4zX2o|title=Rajeev Masand interview with director Sujoy Ghosh on ''Kahaani''|publisher=CNN-IBN|people=Ghosh, Sujoy|type=Television production|date=March 2012|time=4:10|accessdate=30 March 2012|df=|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150712021551/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eaNZSI4zX2o|archivedate=12 July 2015}} === Casting === [[File:Vidya Balan at The DVD launch of 'Kahaani' (3).jpg|thumb|Vidya Balan (on right) was the first choice of director Sujoy Ghosh (on left) for the leading role in the film.| alt= Vidya Balan (on right) and Sujoy Ghosh(on left)]] Vidya Balan was the first choice of both writer Advaita Kala and director Sujoy Ghosh. Ghosh had planned for a long time to work with Vidya and approached her in 2010.{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/aladdin-flopped-as-i-failed-to-tell-a-story-sujoy-ghosh_105652.htm|title=''Aladdin'' flopped as I failed to tell a story: Sujoy Ghosh|publisher=Zee News|agency=IANS|accessdate=6 April 2012|date=10 February 2012}} Unimpressed with the plot outline, Vidya refused, only changing her mind after having read the completed script.{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/vidya-played-choosy-before-saying-yes-for-kahaani_105993.htm|title=Vidya played choosy before saying yes for ''Kahaani''|publisher=Zee News|agency=IANS|accessdate=21 March 2012|date=16 February 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120320180611/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/vidya-played-choosy-before-saying-yes-for-kahaani_105993.htm|archivedate=20 March 2012|df=}} Ghosh chose mostly Bengali actors as he wanted to make the characters as authentic as possible.{{cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/I-wanted-to-be-on-my-toes-Sujoy-Ghosh/Article1-822989.aspx|title=I wanted to be on my toes: Sujoy Ghosh|first=Debasmita|last=Ghosh|newspaper=Hindustan Times|accessdate=22 May 2012|date=9 March 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120522041236/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/I-wanted-to-be-on-my-toes-Sujoy-Ghosh/Article1-822989.aspx|archivedate=22 May 2012|df=}}{{cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/arts/cinema/article3006073.ece|title=The inside story|first=Sangeetha|last=Dundoo|newspaper=[[The Hindu]]|accessdate=22 May 2012|date=17 March 2012|location=Chennai, India|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120421131025/http://www.thehindu.com/arts/cinema/article3006073.ece|archivedate=21 April 2012|df=dmy-all}} The role of the Inspector Satyoki "Rana" Sinha was first offered to [[Chandan Roy Sanyal]], but he could not take the part due to other commitments. Parambrata Chatterjee, a [[Cinema of West Bengal|Bengali actor]] whose acting in the film ''[[The Bong Connection]]'' (2006) had impressed Ghosh at the [[Mumbai Academy of the Moving Image]] festival, was later offered the role in ''Kahaani''.{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-interview-with-parambrata-chatterjee/20120316.htm|title=Meet the other hero of ''Kahaani''|first=Patcy|last=N|publisher=[[Rediff]]|accessdate=16 March 2012|date=16 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120317155741/http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-interview-with-parambrata-chatterjee/20120316.htm|archivedate=17 March 2012|df=}} Chatterjee had earlier worked with Vidya in her début film ''[[Bhalo Theko]]'' (2003).{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-23/news-interviews/31229680_1_vidya-balan-sujoy-ghosh-film-kahaani|title=Vidya Balan my best co-star: Parambrata Chatterjee|newspaper=The Times of India|agency=PTI|accessdate=26 March 2012|date=23 March 2012}} The casting director Roshmi Banerjee suggested Nawazuddin Siddiqui for the role of Khan. Siddiqui, who had only had minor roles in Bollywood up to that time, was surprised that for the first time he would not have to portray a beggar. Saswata Chatterjee, another Bengali actor, was surprised as well when he was offered the role of the contract killer Bob Biswas. He thought there were suitable actors in Hindi film industry for the role.{{cite news|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/politicians-beware-bob-biswas-says-ek-minute/245154-8-66.html|title=Bob Biswas: Saswata Chatterjee, the man behind the cult assassin|first=Rituparna|last=Chatterjee|publisher=CNN-IBN|accessdate=10 April 2012|date=3 April 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120405022534/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/politicians-beware-bob-biswas-says-ek-minute/245154-8-66.html|archivedate=5 April 2012|df=}} He said that Ghosh had known him since childhood and was impressed with his acting, so he wanted him as Bob Biswas.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-30/news-interviews/31255182_1_mobile-phone-bald-patch-character|title=''Kahaani'' is my huge break: Saswata Chatterjee|newspaper=The Times of India|agency=TNN|accessdate=30 March 2012|date=30 March 2012}} Ghosh went against the expectations of casting a popular actor from Bollywood. He signed Bengali actor Abir Chatterjee to play Vidya's husband. According to Ghosh, popular Bollywood actors were not willing to work with him after his two previous flops. He also believed that audience might expect more screen-time from a better-known actor.{{cite web|url=http://indiawest.com/news/3597-sujoy-ghosh-kahaani-could-be-the-story-of-any-mother.html|title=Sujoy Ghosh: ''Kahaani'' could be the story of any mother|first=R.M|last=Vijayakar|publisher=India West|accessdate=22 May 2012|date=19 March 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120512171352/http://indiawest.com/news/3597-sujoy-ghosh-kahaani-could-be-the-story-of-any-mother.html|archivedate=12 May 2012|df=}} Several other Bengali film and television actors, such as Indraneil Sengupta and Kharaj Mukherjee, were cast in supporting roles.{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120316/jsp/entertainment/story_15255285.jsp|title=The ''Kahaani'' of team tolly|date=16 March 2012|newspaper=[[The Telegraph (Calcutta)|The Telegraph]]|accessdate=26 March 2012|location=Calcutta, India|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120322220245/http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120316/jsp/entertainment/story_15255285.jsp|archivedate=22 March 2012|df=}} === Characters === Before the shooting of the film began, Vidya started to use a prosthetic belly to look as close to authentically pregnant as possible. According to news reports, she met doctors and pregnant women to learn about the typical lifestyle and nuances of a pregnant woman, and also made lists of rules and superstitions followed by pregnant women.{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/vidya-balan-gets-into-character-of-pregnant-woman-for-kahaani_104909.htm|title=Vidya Balan gets into character of pregnant woman for ''Kahaani''|publisher=Zee News|agency=[[Asian News International]] (ANI)|accessdate=26 March 2012|date=30 January 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120201033124/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/vidya-balan-gets-into-character-of-pregnant-woman-for-kahaani_104909.htm|archivedate=1 February 2012|df=}} Vidya said that during her college days she often used to imitate pregnant ladies during stand-up acting among friends, an experience that helped her during the shooting.{{cite news|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/vidya-balan-the-dirty-picutre-kahaani-paa-heyy-babyy/1/168320.html|title=Playing pregnant woman was cakewalk for Vidya Balan|work=India Today|agency=IANS|date=11 January 2012|accessdate=3 February 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140111103132/http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/vidya-balan-the-dirty-picutre-kahaani-paa-heyy-babyy/1/168320.html|archivedate=11 January 2014|df=}} While briefing Saswata Chatterjee about his character, the cold-blooded killer Bob Biswas, Ghosh used the phrase ''"Binito Bob"'' (meaning polite Bob), which crystallised the notion of Bob's manners. Further discussions led to the inclusion of paunch and a bald patch. Chatterjee devised the mannerism of rubbing his nails together as some Indians believe doing that helps prevent hair loss. The mannerism was well-noted and praised by the viewers. Ghosh was surprised at how Bob Biswas was greeted by fans as a cult figure. He emphasised that the deliberate ordinariness of Bob Biswas was portrayed so convincingly by Chatterjee that the viewers can expect Bob to be around them at any time and any place.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-22/news-interviews/31224239_1_sujoy-ghosh-fan-frenzy-character|title=Pop art on Saswata Chatterjee's character|first=Roshni|last=Mukherjee|newspaper=The Times of India|agency=TNN|accessdate=11 June 2012|date=22 March 2012}} Parambrata Chatterjee said in an interview that he did not identify with the Rana character, owing to the difference between his own urban upbringing and Rana's rural background.{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/im-not-thinking-of-future-in-bollywood-parambrata-chatterjee/927457/0|title=I'm not thinking of a future in Bollywood: Parambrata Chatterjee|first=Namita|last=Nivas|newspaper=The Indian Express|accessdate=26 March 2012|date=23 March 2012}} Chatterjee visited police stations and did some research "on their work, mindset and other relevant things" to prepare for the role. The character Khan was envisaged as a ruthless, arrogant, expletive-spewing officer who cares nothing about the emotional or social consequences of his behaviour.{{cite video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YtNMKGLGbCU|title=Sujoy Ghosh, director of ''Kahaani'', exclusive interview with Star Ananda|publisher=Star Ananda|people=Ghosh, Sujoy|type=Television production|language=Bengali|date=March 2012|time=8:15|accessdate=30 March 2012|registration=yes|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150711015401/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YtNMKGLGbCU|archivedate=11 July 2015|df=}} Siddiqui said that he was surprised on being offered the role, and wondered how he could portray the arrogance needed for the character.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-15/news-interviews/31196319_1_roles-actors-sarfarosh|title=Nawazuddin Siddiqui on a roll|first=Priyanka|last=Dasgupta|newspaper=The Times of India|agency=TNN|accessdate=26 March 2012|date=15 March 2012}} Ghosh built Khan as a character with lean physical build but full of mental strength, loyalty and patriotism. Khan smokes a relatively cheap brand of cigarette ([[Gold Flake]]) despite his high official post; Siddiqui had smoked that brand of cigarette throughout his struggling days in Bollywood and thereafter. === Filming === [[File:Sindur khela vermilion dashami durga puja bengali.jpg|thumb|The climax showed ''Sindoor khela'', a ritual on the last day of Durga Puja in which married women smear each other's face with ''sindoor'' (vermilion).| alt=One woman smearing the face of another with vermilion]] Filming took place on the streets of Kolkata, where Ghosh often employed the art of [[guerrilla filmmaking]] (shooting in real locations without any previous knowledge given to onlookers) to avoid unwanted attention.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-11/news-interviews/31145194_1_kahaani-sujoy-ghosh-aladin|title=Vidya Balan is a character driven actress: Sujoy Ghosh|newspaper=The Times of India|agency=TNN|accessdate=11 March 2012|date=15 March 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://businessofcinema.com/news/ghanchakkar-vidya-balan-takes-on-the-crowds-again/64019|title=Ghanchakkar: Vidya Balan Takes On The Crowds...Again|publisher=Business of Cinema|accessdate=14 June 2013|date=6 March 2013}} The cinematographer Setu, who had assisted others in the past to shoot documentaries in Kolkata, said that unlike majority of Indian films, ''Kahaani'' was shot mostly without artificial light.{{cite web|url=http://www.filmfare.com/interviews/kolkatas-night-rider-758.html|title=Kolkata's night rider|last=Sharma|first=Devesh|publisher=Filmfare|date=3 July 2012|accessdate=26 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121205104151/http://www.filmfare.com/interviews/kolkatas-night-rider-758.html|archivedate=5 December 2012|df=}} The film was shot in 64 days,{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/playing-pregnant-woman-was-cakewalk-for-vidya_103659.htm|title=Playing pregnant woman was cakewalk for Vidya|publisher=Zee News|agency=IANS|accessdate=21 May 2012|date=11 January 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120115070219/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/playing-pregnant-woman-was-cakewalk-for-vidya_103659.htm|archivedate=15 January 2012|df=}} during which the Durga Puja festival of 2010 took place. Shooting locations in Kolkata included [[Kalighat]] Metro station, Nonapukur tram depot,{{efn|A [[Calcutta Tramways Company]] workshop on Bijli Road in Kolkata.{{cite book|last=Nair|first=P. Thankappan|title=A history of Calcutta's streets|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=o40cAAAAMAAJ|year=1987|publisher=Firma KLM|page=216|oclc=18309970}}}} [[Kumartuli]], [[Howrah Bridge]], [[Victoria Memorial]], old houses of North Kolkata and others.{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/ami-shotti-bolchi-dedicated-to-kolkata-sujoy-ghosh/908494/|title=Vidya Balan's 'Ami Shotti Bolchi' dedicated to Kolkata|date=6 February 2012|accessdate=30 March 2013|newspaper=The Indian Express}} The climax, which takes place on the night of [[Vijayadashami]] (the last day of Durga Puja), was shot on the night of Vijayadashami in the premises of a ''[[Barowari]]'' (publicly organised) Durga Puja celebration in the [[Ballygunge]] neighbourhood of Kolkata. Most of the crowd in the climax were not actors. Some actors mingled with the crowd engaged in ''Sindoor khela''{{efn|''Sindoor khela'' is a ritual on Vijayadashami in which married women anoint each others' faces with ''sindoor'' (vermilion).{{cite book|last1=Foulston|first1=Lynn|last2=Abbott|first2=Stuart|title=Hindu goddesses: beliefs and practices|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=XgwVgPx5G5UC|year=2009|publisher=Sussex Academic Press|isbn=978-1-902210-43-8|page=167}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report_bidding-durga-goodbye-roll-up-your-sleeves-for-sindoor-khela_1755578|title=Bidding Durga goodbye: roll up your sleeves for Sindoor Khela|last=Shukla|first=Ashutosh|newspaper=Daily News and Analysis|date=24 October 2012|accessdate=1 April 2013}}}}—their job was to appreciate the camera angles and accordingly apply ''[[sindoor]]'' (vermilion) on Vidya's face so that accidental exposure of her eyes to ''sindoor'' could be avoided.{{cite web|url=http://www.anandabazar.com/archive/1120407/7enter.html|title='Kahaani' |trans-title = Story|first=Sujoy|last=Ghosh|work=[[Anandabazar Patrika]]|language=Bengali|accessdate=8 April 2012|date=7 April 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120412003648/http://www.anandabazar.com/archive/1120407/7enter.html|archivedate=12 April 2012|df=}} Ghosh chose the guest house in which the protagonist stays after noticing it during his visit to a neighbouring hotel in April 2010. He booked it for 10 days for {{INRConvert|40|k}}, and requested the guest-house employees to keep the shooting schedule a secret. Choosing a room with windows overlooking a busy road, he proceeded to give it an old-fashioned look by replacing the windows' designer grilles with old-fashioned wooden ones, and by painting the room with some rough patches. == Themes and influences == After ''[[Ishqiya]]'' (2010), ''[[No One Killed Jessica]]'' (2011) and ''[[The Dirty Picture]]'' (2011), ''Kahaani'' was Vidya's fourth [[women's film|woman-centric film]]{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/will-vidya-stike-gold-again-with-kahaani_107075.htm|title=Will Vidya strike gold again with ''Kahaani''?|publisher=Zee News|agency=IANS|accessdate=28 March 2012|date=5 March 2012}} to win widespread praise for her unconventional approach to portraying strong female roles.{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/features/2012/kahaani-rave-reviews-critics-verdict-110312.html|title=''Kahaani'' receives rave reviews from film critics|publisher=OneIndia.in|accessdate=11 March 2012|date=11 March 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/FIRST-LOOK-Vidya-Balan-in-Kahaani/Article1-776399.aspx|title=First look: Vidya Balan in ''Kahaani''|newspaper=Hindustan Times|accessdate=1 December 2011|date=1 December 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111201102738/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/FIRST-LOOK-Vidya-Balan-in-Kahaani/Article1-776399.aspx|archivedate=1 December 2011|df=}}{{cite news|url=http://archive.dailypioneer.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=48714:no-ordinary-kahaani&catid=346:show-time|title=No ordinary ''Kahaani''|date=10 March 2012|accessdate=6 April 2012|last=Rao|first=Meenakshi|newspaper=[[The Pioneer (Indian newspaper)|The Pioneer]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140211111647/http://archive.dailypioneer.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=48714%3Ano-ordinary-kahaani&catid=346%3Ashow-time|archivedate=11 February 2014|df=}} According to [[Zee News]], ''Kahaani'' is a woman's film about "role reversals, breaking of stereotypes, turning clichés inside out, a woman's journey, and the way she carves a niche for herself in the male-dominated mentalscape of the society."{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/vidya-s-kahaani-has-a-male-heroine_107445.htm|title=Vidya's ''Kahaani'' has a 'male' heroine!|publisher=Zee News|accessdate=21 March 2012|date=12 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120323014627/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/vidya-s-kahaani-has-a-male-heroine_107445.htm|archivedate=23 March 2012|df=}} Trisha Gupta of ''[[The Indian Express]]'' also finds feminist themes in the film.{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/she-belongs-to-the-city/925371/0|title=She belongs to the city|first=Trisha|last=Gupta|newspaper=The Indian Express|accessdate=30 March 2012|date=19 March 2012}} For Ghosh, one aspect of his project "is a study of motherhood"; the instinct of a mother to protect her baby inspired him to develop the story.{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-sujoy-ghosh-vidya-balan-is-the-hero-of-my-film/20120306.htm|title=There are two heroes in ''Kahaani'': Vidya Balan and Kolkata|first=Ankur|last=Pathak|publisher=Rediff|accessdate=16 March 2012|date=6 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120313003614/http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-sujoy-ghosh-vidya-balan-is-the-hero-of-my-film/20120306.htm|archivedate=13 March 2012|df=}} A recurring theme is the fleeting hint of romance between Rana and Vidya. Ghosh said that this delicate romance was "the most progressive thing" in the film—a suggestion that a man could fall in love with a pregnant woman. The director explained that the boy was initially "fascinated by someone who is literally a hero in his eyes", as Rana was awed by the computer skills of Vidya. Gradually, the fascinated boy moves into a zone where he tries to protect her.{{cite video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eaNZSI4zX2o|title=Rajeev Masand interview with director Sujoy Ghosh on ''Kahaani''|publisher=CNN-IBN|people=Ghosh, Sujoy|type=Television production|date=March 2012|time=2:07|accessdate=30 March 2012|df=|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150712021551/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eaNZSI4zX2o|archivedate=12 July 2015}} [[File:Traffic in Kolkata.jpg|thumb|left|A road in Kolkata showing congested traffic and yellow taxis. The skillful portrayal of the city in the film was noted by reviewers.|alt=A road in Kolkata showing congested traffic and yellow taxis]] Some reviewers note that a major protagonist is Kolkata itself, which is "brimming with warm, sympathetic inhabitants". A review in Rediff.com notes that the director pays a "fond yet understated tribute" to the city by incorporating imagery such as "yellow taxis, leisurely trams, congested traffic, claustrophobic metros, dilapidated brick houses, tapering alleys, rajnigandhas,{{efn|''Rajanigandha'' ([[tuberose]]) flowers are used in religious and social events in India.{{cite book|last=Singh|first=A. K.|title=Flower crops: cultivation and management|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Bfb1T6QbfaAC&pg=PA4|date=1 January 2006|publisher=New India Publishing|isbn=978-81-89422-35-6|page=4}}}} lal paad saris,{{efn|''Lal paad sari'', meaning [[sari]] with red border, usually white sari with red border, is traditionally considered auspicious and worn in many religious or social occasions in [[Bengali culture]].{{cite book|last1=Haque|first1=Enamul|last2=Bhattacharya|first2=Gouriswar|title=Kalhār (white water-lily): studies in art, iconography, architecture, and archaeology of India and Bangladesh|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=wcWfAAAAMAAJ|date=1 March 2007|publisher=Kaveri Books|isbn=978-81-7479-080-4|page=130}}}} piping hot luchis".{{efn|''[[Luchi]]'' is a deep-fried [[flatbread]] made of wheat flour, typical of [[Bengali cuisine|Bengali]] and some other cuisines. It is often eaten with a potato curry or a ''[[dal]]'' made of yellow split-peas.{{cite book|last=Banerji|first=Chitrita|title=Eating India: an Odyssey into the food and culture of the land of spices|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=XfjOQfPtmw0C&pg=PA71|date=10 December 2008|publisher=Bloomsbury Publishing|isbn=978-1-59691-712-5|page=71}}}} According to the reviewer, ''Kahaani'' did not depend on the tropes of Kolkata culture typically used in Bollywood film—"O-emphasizing accent, dramatic play of conch shells, [[rasgulla]]/[[mishti doi]] excesses." The director acknowledges that Kolkata "becomes a central character" of the film.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-15/news-interviews/31196364_1_kolkata-durga-puja-onir|title=''Kahaani'' takes Kolkata beyond cliches|first=Priyanka|last=Dasgupta|newspaper=The Times of India|agency=TNN|accessdate=15 March 2012|date=15 March 2012}} Gautaman Bhaskaran, writing for ''[[Gulf Times]]'', notes that Kolkata imagery was polished up in the film; noted Bengali director [[Srijit Mukherji]] argues that the portrayal of the city in ''Kahaani'' was akin to a "[[Lonely Planet]] exotica" on the city.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-24/news-interviews/31233578_1_srijit-mukherji-films-shooting/3|title=Hemlock is far from a morbid film: Srijit Mukherji|first=Satadru|last=Ojha|newspaper=The Times of India|accessdate=8 May 2012|date=24 March 2012}} Uddalak Mukherjee of ''The Telegraph'' explains that Kolkata in ''Kahaani'' was cosmetic and lacked a deep menacing presence. Mukherjee argues the depiction of the city never matches the level of [[Satyajit Ray]]'s [[Calcutta trilogy]], where "aided by bloodshed, greed and decadence, ...Calcutta ..., even though a place of dreams, desires and hope, slides irreversibly into chaos, anxiety and a moral crisis, taking its residents with it". Durga Puja, the autumnal festival to worship goddess [[Durga]], plays a prominent role in the story.{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120412/jsp/opinion/story_15361368.jsp#.T6lsl9kqxJF|title=A tale of two cities|newspaper=The Telegraph|first=Uddalak|last=Mukherjee|accessdate=8 May 2012|date=12 April 2012|location=Calcutta, India|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140110170856/http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120412/jsp/opinion/story_15361368.jsp|archivedate=10 January 2014|df=}} The allegorical yearly return of goddess Durga to slay the demon [[Mahishasura]] is alluded to at the end of the film. According to Uddalak Mukherjee of ''The Telegraph'', "Durga Puja, with its [[paraphernalia]] of idols, immersion processions, ''[[pandals]]'', even an entire crowd of women draped in white ''saris'' with red borders, is central to the film's ... visual aesthetic." A review in Rediff.com praised the depiction of the festivities in Kolkata, a city well known for its celebration of Durga Puja. [[File:Pratima Visarjan by Gaganendranath Tagore.png|thumb|upright|The colour scheme of ''Kahaani'' was inspired by the painting ''Pratima Visarjan'' by [[Gaganendranath Tagore]].|alt=A painting by Gaganendranath Tagore depicting the color inspiration of the film]] Ghosh acknowledges the allusions to Ray's films. In one scene, Vidya asks the manager of the guest house why there is no hot water although the signboard had claimed "running hot water". The manager explains that the sign refers for his errand boy, who runs to deliver hot water in a kettle whenever required. This alludes to a similar scene in Ray's ''[[Joi Baba Felunath (film)|Joi Baba Felunath]]'' (1979).{{cite web|url=http://www.anandabazar.com/archive/1120317/17cine1.html|title='Asamanya' |trans-title = Extraordinary|first=Jagari|last=Bandyopadhyay|work=Anandabazar Patrika|language=Bengali|accessdate=18 March 2012|date=17 March 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120322045703/http://www.anandabazar.com/archive/1120317/17cine1.html|archivedate=22 March 2012|df=}} In an interview with ''The Telegraph'', Ghosh says that the way Vidya looks out and moves from window to window in the guest-house room is reminiscent of Ray's ''[[Charulata]]'' (1964), where the actress [[Madhabi Mukherjee]] enjoys glimpses of the outside world through the blinds of windows. He also acknowledges the influence of ''[[Mahanagar]]'' (1963), another Ray film noted for its portrayal of Kolkata. According to the director, he was inspired by particular scenes of Ray's ''[[Nayak (1966 film)|Nayak]]'' (1966) to plan the portrayal of complex emotional issues between Vidya and the police officer Rana, especially Rana's awe in the presence of Vidya. Ghosh expresses his inspiration from Ray's ''[[Aranyer Dinratri]]'' (1970) in which Ray "wanted the audience to be inside the car with the four guys all the time. So the camera never leaves the car." Ghosh shot a similar scene, hoping the audience would become "like Vidya's fellow passenger."{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120314/jsp/entertainment/story_15245793.jsp|title=Salaam namaste|first=Pratim D.|last=Gupta|newspaper=The Telegraph|accessdate=18 March 2012|date=14 March 2012|location=Calcutta, India|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120316180512/http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120314/jsp/entertainment/story_15245793.jsp|archivedate=16 March 2012|df=}} Besides Ray's films, Ghosh also admits inspiration from what he calls "visually striking" films of the 1970s and 1980s, such as ''[[Deewaar]]'' (1975). Critics have compared the fake-pregnancy twist of ''Kahaani'' with the 2004 American psychological thriller ''[[Taking Lives (film)|Taking Lives]]''. The sequences towards the end that explain the missing pieces of the mystery were compared with ''[[The Usual Suspects]]'' (1995). Ghosh writes that the film was heavily influenced by the colour scheme of the ''Pratima Visarjan'', a c.1915 watercolour by the [[Bengal School of Art|Bengal School]] artist [[Gaganendranath Tagore]]. == Soundtrack == {{Infobox album | name = Kahaani | type = Soundtrack | artist = [[Vishal–Shekhar]] | cover = | alt = | released = 14 February 2012 | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Film soundtrack]] | length = 28:18 | label = [[Super Cassettes Industries T-Series|Super Cassettes Industries Limited]] | producer = Abhijit Nalani, [[Mickey McCleary]], [[Clinton Cerejo]] | prev_title = [[The Dirty Picture]] | prev_year = 2011 | next_title = [[Shanghai (2012 film)|Shanghai]] | next_year = 2012 }} The musical score was composed by [[Vishal–Shekhar]], and the lyrics for the film's six songs were written by Vishal Dadlani, Anvita Dutt and Sandeep Srivastava. Several of [[R. D. Burman]]'s Hindi and Bengali compositions were used in the background. An album of the music was released on 22 February 2012 and subsequently on the [[Music download|digital music]] platform [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] [[iTunes]] India since its inception from mid-2012.{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/in/album/kahaani-original-motion-picture/id507392970|title=Kahaani (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack)|publisher=iTunes|work=Vishal-Shekhar|accessdate=9 October 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131105115627/https://itunes.apple.com/in/album/kahaani-original-motion-picture/id507392970|archivedate=5 November 2013|df=}} The soundtrack received positive reviews, and was praised for its amalgamation of Bengali and Hindi lyrics. A review in [[CNN-IBN]] states that the song "Ami Shotti Bolchi" is able to partially convey the feel of Kolkata, and that the soundtrack "features right voices with the overall mood of the album".{{cite news|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/music-review-kahaani-focuses-on-nostalgia/232715-45-76.html|title=Music review: ''Kahaani'' focuses on nostalgia|first=Rohit|last=Vats|publisher=CNN-IBN|accessdate=30 March 2012|date=24 February 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120418153137/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/music-review-kahaani-focuses-on-nostalgia/232715-45-76.html|archivedate=18 April 2012|df=}} ''[[Mumbai Mirror]]'' rated the album with 3 stars out of 5.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-02-29/music-reviews/31110240_1_vishal-shekhar-special-appearance-guitars|title=''Kahaani'' music review|newspaper=The Times of India|author=[[Mumbai Mirror]]|accessdate=15 May 2012|date=29 February 2012}} Reviewing the soundtrack for [[Indiatimes]], Anand Vaishnav commented that "''Kahaani'', as an album, stays honest to the theme of the film".{{cite news|url=http://www.indiatimes.com/bollywood/music-review-kahaani-12663.html|title=Music review—''Kahaani''|first=Anand|last=Vaishnav|work=[[The Times of India]]|accessdate=15 May 2012|date=15 February 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120317000028/http://www.indiatimes.com/bollywood/music-review-kahaani-12663.html|archivedate=17 March 2012|df=}} {{Track listing |extra_column=Singer(s) |total_length=28:18 |all_lyrics=Vishal Dadlani, Anvita Dutt and Sandeep Srivastava, except where noted |title1=Aami Shotti Bolchi |extra1=[[Usha Uthup]], Vishwesh Krishnamurthy |length1=3:20 |title2=Piya Tu Kahe Rootha Re |extra2=[[Javed Bashir]] |length2=4:59 |title3=Kahaani (Male) |extra3=[[Krishnakumar Kunnath|KK]], [[Vishal Dadlani]] |length3=4:26 |title4=Tore Bina |extra4=[[Sukhwinder Singh]] |length4=5:52 |title5=Kahaani (Female) |extra5=[[Shreya Ghoshal]], Vishal Dadlani |length5=4:28 |title6=[[Ekla Cholo Re]] |extra6=[[Amitabh Bachchan]] |note6=[[Rabindra Sangeet]] |length6=5:13 }} == Marketing and release == ''Kahaani''{{'}}s first-look poster was launched on 2 December 2011,{{cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/FIRST-LOOK-Vidya-Balan-in-Kahaani/Article1-776399.aspx|title=First look: Vidya Balan in ''Kahaani''|newspaper=Hindustan Times|accessdate=4 May 2012|date=2 December 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120522021907/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/FIRST-LOOK-Vidya-Balan-in-Kahaani/Article1-776399.aspx|archivedate=22 May 2012|df=}} and the official trailer on 5 January 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.ndtv.com/video/player/news/first-look-of-vidya-balans-i-kahaani-i-launched/220329?sp |archive-url = https://archive.is/20120903215447/http://www.ndtv.com/video/player/news/first-look-of-vidya-balans-i-kahaani-i-launched/220329?sp |dead-url = yes |archive-date = 3 September 2012|title=First look of Vidya Balan's ''Kahaani'' launched|publisher=NDTV|accessdate=4 May 2012|date=5 January 2012}} The poster, portraying a pregnant Vidya Balan and lacking any romantic element, was well received. Critics' expectations were low, owing to the director's previous box-office failures. Vidya appeared in public with a prosthetic belly to promote the film, and mingled with the public in railway stations, bus stands and markets.{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/celebrity/vidya-s-arnab-bagchi-found_107140.htm|title=Vidya's Arnab Bagchi found!|publisher=Zee News|accessdate=26 March 2012|date=6 March 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-05/news-interviews/31123542_1_kahaani-vidya-balan-pregnant-woman|title=Vidya Balan to promote ''Kahaani'' in Ahmedabad|first=Tanvi|last=Trivedi|newspaper=The Times of India|agency=TNN|accessdate=9 April 2012|date=5 March 2012}} She often carried a sketch of her on-screen missing husband, and asked people to help in finding him.{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120305/jsp/entertainment/story_15211741.jsp#.UZ7uTrVQHzw|last1=Dutta|first1=Sneha|last2=Roy|first2=Priyanka|title=Vidya's story|newspaper=The Telegraph|accessdate=24 May 2013|date=5 March 2012|location=Calcutta, India|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120509220143/http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120305/jsp/entertainment/story_15211741.jsp|archivedate=9 May 2012|df=}} Social-networking website [[Ibibo]].com developed an online game, ''The Great Indian Parking Wars'', which required players to park Vidya's taxi on a street; it was well-received, reaching 50,000 hits in 10 days.{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/and-more/vidya-balan-s-kahaani-hit-among-online-gamers_107968.htm|title=Vidya Balan's ''Kahaani'' hit among online gamers|publisher=Zee News|agency=IANS|accessdate=21 March 2012|date=20 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120322235701/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/and-more/vidya-balan-s-kahaani-hit-among-online-gamers_107968.htm|archivedate=22 March 2012|df=}} [[File:Vidya Balan at success bash of 'Kahaani'.jpg|thumb|Vidya (centre) and Chatterjee (to her right) celebrate the success of ''Kahaani''.|alt=Actress Vidya Balan cuts a cake celebrating the success of ''Kahaani'' while actor Parambrata Chatterjee watches, along with several others.]] On 5 March 2012, prior to release, Kolkata Metro authorities objected to a scene in which Vidya is pushed by a man onto the tracks as a train arrives. They requested that the scene be removed, as it would remind people of the past suicides, which had tarnished the railway's image.{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/kahaani-s-dream-kolkata-metro-s-nightmare_107035.htm|title=''Kahaani''{{'}}s dream, Kolkata metro's nightmare |publisher=Zee News |agency=IANS |accessdate=21 March 2012 |date=5 March 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120308002405/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/kahaani-s-dream-kolkata-metro-s-nightmare_107035.htm |archivedate= 8 March 2012 |df= }} The filmmakers screened the scene for the authorities and explained that nothing in the film would affect the image of the Metro or prompt people to commit suicide. Convinced, the officials withdrew their objections, and the scene was retained, although it was removed from trailers.{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/metro-clears-vidya-s-scene-in-kahaani_107083.htm|title=Metro clears Vidya's scene in ''Kahaani''|publisher=Zee News|agency=PTI|accessdate=21 March 2012|date=5 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120308225920/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/metro-clears-vidya-s-scene-in-kahaani_107083.htm|archivedate=8 March 2012|df=}} ''Kahaani'' was released on 9 March 2012, a day after [[International Women's Day]].{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/celebrity/vidya-s-kahaani-a-celebration-of-womanhood_107271.htm|title=Vidya's ''Kahaani'': a celebration of womanhood|publisher=Zee News|accessdate=2 April 2012|date=8 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120411121950/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/celebrity/vidya-s-kahaani-a-celebration-of-womanhood_107271.htm|archivedate=11 April 2012|df=}} It played on 1100 screens worldwide. CNN-IBN reported that although ''Kahaani'' was ready before ''The Dirty Picture'', distributors deferred its release, fearing that Vidya's role of a sexy siren (in ''The Dirty Picture'') after that of a pregnant woman might not be received well.{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/kahaani-the-mother-of-a-success-story/243546-8-66.html|title=''Kahaani'': The mother of a success story|first=Shilpa|last=Rathnam|publisher=CNN-IBN|accessdate=28 March 2012|date=28 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120330212811/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/kahaani-the-mother-of-a-success-story/243546-8-66.html|archivedate=30 March 2012|df=}} [[STAR TV]] bought the exclusive right to broadcast the film for a price of {{INRConvert|80|m}},{{cite web|url=http://www.media247.co.uk/atlantic/star-tv-acquires-kahaani-housefull-2-others|title=Star TV acquires ''Kahaani'', ''Housefull 2'' & others|first=Lakh|last=Baddhan|publisher=Media 247|work=Biz Asia Atlantic|accessdate=6 June 2012|date=5 April 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130505074231/http://www.media247.co.uk/atlantic/star-tv-acquires-kahaani-housefull-2-others|archivedate=5 May 2013|df=dmy-all}}{{cite video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pcmM4TCnEX4|title=''Kahaani'''s tv rights sold for 8 crore|publisher=ZingTV|type=Television production|date=March 2012|time=0:52|accessdate=6 June 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150714034106/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pcmM4TCnEX4|archivedate=14 July 2015|df=}} which was the highest-ever price paid for a female-centric film in India. The Indian television premiere of the film was on [[STAR (India)|Star India's]] channel [[Movies OK]] on 3 June 2012.{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.in.msn.com/tv/movies-ok-to-dazzle-viewers|title=Movies OK to dazzle viewers|publisher=MSN India|accessdate=7 June 2012|date=29 May 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120615192009/http://entertainment.in.msn.com/tv/movies-ok-to-dazzle-viewers|archivedate=15 June 2012|df=}} The DVD of the film was released on 17 May 2012 across all regions in a one-disc pack in NTSC format.{{cite video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4KDYwcnv4ho|type=Television production|title=Vidya Balan at ''Kahaani'' DVD launch|publisher=Mid Day|date=May 2012|time=1:55|accessdate=22 May 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150705204132/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4KDYwcnv4ho|archivedate=5 July 2015|df=}} Distributed by [[Shemaroo Entertainment]],{{cite web|url=http://www.greatdealworld.com/kahaani--p-3368.html|title=''Kahaani'' (DVD)|publisher=Great Deal World|work=[[Shemaroo Entertainment]]|accessdate=22 May 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121216102451/http://www.greatdealworld.com/kahaani--p-3368.html|archivedate=16 December 2012|df=}} it contained additional content, such as behind-the-scene footage, video of celebration parties after its theatrical release, and music videos of the songs of the film.{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.in/Kahaani-Parambrata-Chatterjee/dp/B007Y5ZTGY|title=Kahaani|publisher=Amazon.in|accessdate=9 February 2018}} The [[VCD]] and [[Blu-ray]] versions were released at the same time.{{cite web|url=http://www.greatdealworld.com/kahaani--p-3369.html|title=''Kahaani'' (VCD)|publisher=Great Deal World|work=Shemaroo Entertainment|accessdate=22 May 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150621105913/http://www.greatdealworld.com/kahaani--p-3369.html|archivedate=21 June 2015|df=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.greatdealworld.com/kahaani--p-3370.html|title=''Kahaani'' (Blu-ray)|publisher=Great Deal World|work=Shemaroo Entertainment|accessdate=22 May 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150621170617/http://www.greatdealworld.com/kahaani--p-3370.html|archivedate=21 June 2015|df=}} == Reception == {{See also|List of accolades received by Kahaani}} ''Kahaani'' garnered generally positive reviews from critics. According to review aggregator ''Review Gang'' the film received a rating of 7.5 out of 10,{{cite web|url=http://www.reviewgang.com/movies/225-Kahaani-Review|title=''Kahaani'' movie review|publisher=''Review Gang''|accessdate=9 March 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120310083455/http://www.reviewgang.com/movies/225-Kahaani-Review|archivedate=10 March 2012|df=}} based on the reviews by professional critics. Good [[word of mouth]] publicity played a part in its popularity besides the positive reviews.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-19/news-interviews/31209950_1_box-office-starrer-release|title=Word-of-mouth promos pay off at box office|last=Dubey|first=Bharati|date=19 March 2012|accessdate=23 March 2013|work=The Times of India}}{{cite web|url=http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/kahaani-paan-singh-tomar-on-a-roll-at-box-office-187827|title=''Kahaani'', ''Paan Singh Tomar'' on a roll at box office|publisher=NDTV|date=20 March 2012|accessdate=23 March 2013}} ''[[The Telegraph (Calcutta)|The Telegraph]]'' called the film "a mind-juggling medley of manipulation masquerading as a 'mother of a story'".{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120310/jsp/entertainment/story_15231247.jsp#.T3F0dEoQgrU|title=What a ''Kahaani''|first=Pratim D.|last=Gupta|newspaper=The Telegraph|accessdate=27 March 2012|date=10 March 2012|location=Calcutta, India|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120313013944/http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120310/jsp/entertainment/story_15231247.jsp|archivedate=13 March 2012|df=}} [[Taran Adarsh]] of [[Bollywood Hungama]] gave the film 4 out of 5 stars, and praised Vidya's acting.{{cite web|url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/moviemicro/criticreview/id/542221|publisher=Bollywood Hungama|title=''Kahaani'' movie review|first=Taran|last=Adarsh|accessdate=8 March 2012|date=8 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120310001958/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/moviemicro/criticreview/id/542221|archivedate=10 March 2012|df=}} ''[[The Times of India]]'' commented "Once again, a 'pregnant' Vidya, ironically displays more 'male ornaments' ... than most heroes."{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/hindi/Kahaani/movie-review/12188039.cms|title=''Kahaani'' movie review|first=Madhureeta|last=Mukherjee|newspaper=The Times of India|accessdate=8 March 2012|date=8 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120308172450/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/hindi/Kahaani/movie-review/12188039.cms|archivedate=8 March 2012|df=}} The reviews in [[Rediff]],{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-vidya-balan-rocks-in-kahaani/20120309.htm|title=Review: Vidya Balan rocks in ''Kahaani''|first=Sukanya|last=Verma|publisher=Rediff|accessdate=9 March 2012|date=9 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120311222230/http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/review-vidya-balan-rocks-in-kahaani/20120309.htm|archivedate=11 March 2012|df=}} [[Indo-Asian News Service|Indo Asian News Service]],{{cite news|url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_review.aspx?id=689|title=Review: ''Kahaani''|first=Subhash K.|last=Jha|publisher=NDTV|agency=IANS|accessdate=5 April 2012|date=9 March 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120416035934/http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_review.aspx?id=689|archivedate=16 April 2012|df=}} CNN-IBN,{{cite news|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/masand-a-taut-kahaani-is-a-delicious-thriller/237674-47-84.html|title=Masand: A taut ''Kahaani'' is a delicious thriller|first=Rajeev|last=Masand|publisher=CNN-IBN|accessdate=5 April 2012|date=10 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120413114323/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/masand-a-taut-kahaani-is-a-delicious-thriller/237674-47-84.html|archivedate=13 April 2012|df=}} Zee News,{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/review-vidya-kolkata-in-a-never-seen-before-avatar-in-kahaani_107278.htm|title=Review: Vidya, Kolkata in a never-seen-before avatar in ''Kahaani''|first=Shomini|last=Sen|publisher=Zee News|accessdate=10 March 2012|date=10 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120312023421/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/review-vidya-kolkata-in-a-never-seen-before-avatar-in-kahaani_107278.htm|archivedate=12 March 2012|df=}} ''[[Hindustan Times]]'',{{cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Reviews/Anupama-Chopra-s-review-Kahaani/Article1-823366.aspx|title=Anupama Chopra's review: ''Kahaani''|first=Anupama|last=Chopra|newspaper=Hindustan Times|accessdate=17 March 2012|date=10 March 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120316232942/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Reviews/Anupama-Chopra-s-review-Kahaani/Article1-823366.aspx|archivedate=16 March 2012|df=}} and ''[[The Hindu]]''{{cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/life-and-style/nxg/article2994454.ece|title=''Kahaani''—Twists in the tale|first=Balaji|last=Ravi|newspaper=The Hindu|accessdate=14 March 2012|date=14 March 2012|location=Chennai, India|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120316183409/http://www.thehindu.com/life-and-style/nxg/article2994454.ece|archivedate=16 March 2012|df=dmy-all}} were unanimously positive, and noted script, direction, cinematography, and acting as strong points of the film. Noted film actress and multiple [[National Film Awards|National Award]] winner [[Shabana Azmi]] lauded Vidya for her performance,"As an actor, I could see she [Vidya] was making all the right moves throughout the film. There was not a single artificial note in her performance."{{cite news|url=http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/vidya-should-avoid-pitfall-of-doing-central-parts-shabana_107995.htm|title=Vidya should avoid pitfall of doing central parts: Shabana|publisher=Zee News|agency=IANS|accessdate=21 March 2012|date=21 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120324093201/http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/movies/vidya-should-avoid-pitfall-of-doing-central-parts-shabana_107995.htm|archivedate=24 March 2012|df=}} Russell Edwards, the reviewer for ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'', praised the cast, cinematography, and direction, and commented that despite occasional glitches, the "adroit thriller ... maintains momentum and credibility."{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2012/film/reviews/kahaani-1117947230/|title='Kahaani'|last=Edwards|first=Russell|date=12 March 2012|accessdate=21 March 2013|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304110016/http://variety.com/2012/film/reviews/kahaani-1117947230/|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=}} Many reviewers criticised the film's climax and certain features, feeling that they deviated from its general style. Rituparna Chatterjee of CNN-IBN noted that the climax of the film was a "huge dampener" and explained, "The diabolic twist at that juncture got underplayed ... What follows is a sobfest ... the apologetic explanation of why she does what she does. Justifying her action comes across more as an effort to appease the Indian morality".{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/kahaani-why-the-film-doesnt-work-for-me/238393-8-66.html|title=''Kahaani'': Why the film doesn't work for me|first=Rituparna|last=Chatterjee|publisher=CNN-IBN|accessdate=15 March 2012|date=12 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120314225924/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/kahaani-why-the-film-doesnt-work-for-me/238393-8-66.html|archivedate=14 March 2012|df=}} The ''[[Outlook (magazine)|Outlook]]'' review noted, "At times, ''Kahaani'' is too clever, at others extremely pedestrian like in the depiction of computer hacking and IB operations, not to speak of the ludicrous terrorist angle and the all-too predictable Durga Puja setting for that mythology tie-in."{{cite web|url=http://www.outlookindia.com/article.aspx?280230|title=Movie review: ''Kahaani''|first=Namrata|last=Joshi|work=[[Outlook (magazine)|Outlook]]|accessdate=17 March 2012|date=26 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120317171218/http://outlookindia.com/article.aspx?280230|archivedate=17 March 2012|df=}} It adds that the "spoon-feeding" of reasons at the end dampens the intrigue factor. The review in [[Yahoo!]] India comments that the Durga metaphor at the end was enforced, and that the film over-indulged in Bengali stereotypes.{{cite web|url=http://in.movies.yahoo.com/blogs/movie-reviews/kahaani-review-190252653.html|title=Kahaani review|last=Guha|first=Kunal|publisher=Yahoo India|date=8 March 2012|accessdate=22 March 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131020220401/http://in.movies.yahoo.com/blogs/movie-reviews/kahaani-review-190252653.html|archivedate=20 October 2013|df=}} Gautaman Bhaskaran, in his review in ''Gulf Times'', noted that the sometimes-handheld photography was "as irksome as the plot with a sleuth too many and cops galore."{{cite news|url=http://www.gautamanbhaskaran.com/gb/images/joy.pdf|title=The story of ''Kahaani''|first=Gautaman|last=Bhaskaran|newspaper=Gulf Times|format=PDF|page=6|accessdate=15 March 2013|date=14 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303213009/http://www.gautamanbhaskaran.com/gb/images/joy.pdf|archivedate=3 March 2016|df=}} Though ''Kahaani'' received critical acclaim, it was a slow starter at the box office, opening to a poor response on the first day,{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4138&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120626145331/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4138&nCat=|archivedate=26 June 2012|title=''Kahaani'' Friday business|publisher=Box Office India|accessdate=24 May 2013|date=10 March 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/npages.php?page=shownews&articleid=4129&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120626115429/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/npages.php?page=shownews&articleid=4129&nCat=|archivedate=26 June 2012|title='Kahaani'' expected to lead ''Chaar Din Ki Chandni''|publisher=Box Office India|accessdate=24 May 2013|date=7 March 2012}} but gradually picking afterwards.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4171&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120627022250/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4171&nCat=|archivedate=27 June 2012|title=''Kahaani'' is super hit: Heads for 45–50 crore|publisher=Box Office India|accessdate=5 April 2012|date=18 March 2012}} According to ''The Telegraph'', the film earned almost {{INRConvert|20|m}} from the state of West Bengal within the first three days of its release. At [[Multiplex (movie theater)|multiplexes]] in Kolkata, occupancy increased from 47% on Friday 9 March, the day of release, to 77% on 10 March and to around 97% on 11 March.{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120313/jsp/calcutta/story_15241893.jsp|title='Bidya' hits BO bullseye—Calcutta's ''Kahaani'' is a word-of-mouth rage|first=Priyanka|last=Roy|newspaper=The Telegraph|accessdate=22 May 2012|date=13 March 2012|location=Calcutta, India|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120421212245/http://www.telegraphindia.com/1120313/jsp/calcutta/story_15241893.jsp|archivedate=21 April 2012|df=}} [[Box Office India]], a website on Indian film trade, reported that the film collected nearly {{INRConvert|240|m}} in its first week, well beyond its production cost of {{INRConvert|80|m}}.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/overdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4174&nCat=|title=Kahaani Week One Territorial Breakdown|publisher=Box Office India|date=19 March 2012|accessdate=19 March 2012}} It grossed {{INRConvert|190|m}} in second week to make a two-week total of around {{INRConvert|430|m}} in India;{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/overdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4202&nCat=|title=Kahaani Week Two Territorial Breakdown|publisher=[[Box Office India]]|date=26 March 2012|accessdate=26 March 2012}} this led Box Office India to declare the film a "Super Hit".{{cite web|url=http://boxofficeindia.com/boxdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4192&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120626153806/http://boxofficeindia.com/boxdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=4192&nCat=|archivedate=26 June 2012|title=''Agent Vinod'' average opening ''Kahaani'' extraordinary week two|publisher=Box Office India|accessdate=24 March 2012|date=24 March 2012}} The film was successful in the international box office as well, garnering {{INRConvert|80|m}} within 10 days of its release in seven markets—UK, US, UAE, Australia, New Zealand, Malaysia and Pakistan, according to Bollywood Hungama, a film-related website.{{cite web|url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/trade/boxofficeoverseas/id/412|title=''Kahaani'' overtakes ''TDP'' in overseas|first=Taran|last=Adarsh|publisher=Bollywood Hungama|accessdate=8 May 2012|date=20 March 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120430182542/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/trade/boxofficeoverseas/id/412|archivedate=30 April 2012|df=}} By the third week, according to CNN-IBN, it had grossed {{INRConvert|750|m}}, including India and overseas market.{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/kahaani-grosses-rs-75-crore-at-the-box-office/242076-8-66.html|title=''Kahaani'' grosses Rs 75 crore at the box office: The story behind the numbers|publisher=CNN-IBN|accessdate=23 March 2012|date=23 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120324183623/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/kahaani-grosses-rs-75-crore-at-the-box-office/242076-8-66.html|archivedate=24 March 2012|df=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/kahaani-whats-the-story-behind-the-numbers-253056.html|title=''Kahaani'': What's the story behind the numbers?|publisher=Firstpost|accessdate=22 March 2012|date=22 March 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120324132904/http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/kahaani-whats-the-story-behind-the-numbers-253056.html|archivedate=24 March
